properties.Name: AirWaybill
properties.Description:
A shipping document used by the airlines for air freight. It serves as a contract for carriage and includes carrier conditions of carriage such as limits of liability and claims procedures. The air waybill also contains shipping instructions to the airline, a description of the commodity, and applicable transportation charges. The airline industry has adopted a standard formatted air waybill that accommodates both domestic and international traffic.

Air Waybills are not negotiable. 

A air transport bill of lading covering both domestic and international flights transporting goods to a specific destination.

It is a contract for carriage that includes carrier conditions of carriage including such items as limits of liability and claims procedures.

The Air Way Bill contains shipping instructions to airlines, a description of the commodity and applicable transportation charges.

The Air Way Bill is a non-negotiable instrument that serves as a receipt for the shipper, which indicates that the Carrier has accepted the goods listed and obligating the Carrier to carry the consignment to the airport of destination according to the specified conditions.

A shipping document used by the airlines for air freight.  It serves as a contract for carriage and includes carrier conditions of carriage such as limits of liability and claims procedures.  The air waybill also contains shipping instructions to the airline, a description of the commodity, and applicable transportation charges.  The airline industry has adopted a standard formatted air waybill that accommodates both domestic and international traffic.

Columns.Name: ShipmentId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Shipment.

Columns.Name: DocumentId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Document.

Columns.Name: ShippersName
Columns.Description: The Shipper's name, which normally is the same as shown in Shipment.

Columns.Name: ShippersAddress
Columns.Description: The 'street' component of the Shipper's address, which is normally the same as that shown in the Shipment.

Columns.Name: ShippersCity
Columns.Description: The 'city' component of the Shipper's address, which is normally the same as that shown in the Shipment.

Columns.Name: ShippersStateProvince
Columns.Description: The 'state/province' component of the Shipper's address, which is normally the same as that shown in the Shipment.

Columns.Name: ShippersZipPostalCode
Columns.Description: The 'zip/postal code' component of the Shipper's address, which is normally the same as that shown in the Shipment.

Columns.Name: ShippersCountry
Columns.Description: The 'country' component of the Shipper's address, which is normally the same as that shown in the Shipment.

Columns.Name: ConsigneeName
Columns.Description: The name of the Air Way Bill Consignee.

Columns.Name: ConsigneeAddress
Columns.Description: The 'street' component of the Air Way Bill Consignee.

Columns.Name: ConsigneeCity
Columns.Description: The 'city' component of the Air Way Bill Consignee.

Columns.Name: ConsigneeStateProvince
Columns.Description: The 'state/province' component of the Air Way Bill Consignee.

Columns.Name: ConsigneeZipPostalCode
Columns.Description: The 'zip/postal code' component of the Air Way Bill Consignee.

Columns.Name: ConsigneeCountry
Columns.Description: The 'country' component of the Air Way Bill Consignee.

Columns.Name: IssuingCarrierName
Columns.Description: The name of the Carrier issuing the Air Waybill.

Columns.Name: IssuingCarrierAgentName
Columns.Description: The name of the Carrier's Agent.

Columns.Name: IssuingCarrierAgentAddress
Columns.Description: The 'street' component of the Agent's address.

Columns.Name: IssuingCarrierAgentCity
Columns.Description: The 'city' component of the Agent's address.

Columns.Name: IssuingCarrierAgentStateProvince
Columns.Description: The 'state/province' component of the Agent's address.

Columns.Name: IssuingCarrierAgentZipPostalCode
Columns.Description: The 'zip/postal code' component of the Agent's address.

Columns.Name: IssuingCarrierAgentCountry
Columns.Description: The 'country' component of the Agent's address.

Columns.Name: AirportOfDepartureName
Columns.Description: The name of the airport from which the shipment is to depart.

Columns.Name: AirportOfDestinationName
Columns.Description: The name of the airport to which the shipment is to be shipped.

Columns.Name: DepartingFlightNumber
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of an Air Carrier flight.

Columns.Name: HandlingInformation
Columns.Description: Information regarding the handling of the shipment/shipment items.

Columns.Name: ConditionsOfContract
Columns.Description: The terms and conditions established by the air carriers for the carriage of goods. These conditions are printed on the Air Waybill and include such items as limits of liability, claims limitations, indemnity and dimensional weight rules.

Columns.Name: NeutralAirWaybillIndicator
Columns.Description: A standard air waybill without identification of issuing carrier

Columns.Name: InsurancePolicyNumber
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of an Insurance Policy.

Columns.Name: DeclaredValueForCarriageAmount
Columns.Description: The maximum of transportation liability for any loss, damage, delay, misdelivery, nondelivery, misinformation or any failure to provide information.

Columns.Name: DeclaredValueForCustomsAmount
Columns.Description: The total declared value of the Air Way Bill Items that are declared for Customs.

Columns.Name: TotalInsuranceChargeAmount
Columns.Description: The total amount of insurance charges.

Columns.Name: TotalChargesDueAgentAmount
Columns.Description: The total amount due the Carrier's Agent.

Columns.Name: TaxChargeAmount
Columns.Description: The total amount of taxes due.

Columns.Name: TotalChargedDueCarrierAmount
Columns.Description: The total amount due the Carrier.

Columns.Name: TotalPrepaidAmount
Columns.Description:
The total amount of prepaid charges.

A freight term, which indicates that charges are to be paid by the shipper. Prepaid shipping charges may be added to the customer invoice, or the cost may be bundled into the pricing of the product.

Columns.Name: TotalCollectAmount
Columns.Description: The total amount of collect shipping charges.

Columns.Name: TotalValuationChargeAmount
Columns.Description: Transportation charges assessed shippers who declare a value of goods higher than value of carrier's' limits of liability.

Columns.Name: CartageChargeAmount
Columns.Description: The charges for cartage, which is for the transferring of goods by trucks, wagons, drays, etc., for short haul or transfer.

Columns.Name: ForwardingChargeAmount
Columns.Description: The total amount of forwarding charges, which is for an individual, partnership, or corporation who engages in the business of transporting goods, but does not operate equipment.  The forwarder arranges transportation by using subcontracted operations and may issue bills of lading with its transportation services. (ex. NWII)

Columns.Name: CurrencyId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Currency.

Columns.Name: TotalShipmentBilledWeight
Columns.Description: The total weight shown in the Waybill for the quantity of items transported.

Columns.Name: AirWaybillTypeId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of an Air Waybill Type.

Columns.Name: AirWaybillStatusId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of an Air Waybill Status.

A shipping document used by the airlines for air freight. It serves as a contract for carriage and includes carrier conditions of carriage such as limits of liability and claims procedures. The air waybill also contains shipping instructions to the airline, a description of the commodity, and applicable transportation charges. The airline industry has adopted a standard formatted air waybill that accommodates both domestic and international traffic.

Air Waybills are not negotiable. 

A air transport bill of lading covering both domestic and international flights transporting goods to a specific destination.

It is a contract for carriage that includes carrier conditions of carriage including such items as limits of liability and claims procedures.

The Air Way Bill contains shipping instructions to airlines, a description of the commodity and applicable transportation charges.

The Air Way Bill is a non-negotiable instrument that serves as a receipt for the shipper, which indicates that the Carrier has accepted the goods listed and obligating the Carrier to carry the consignment to the airport of destination according to the specified conditions.

The air waybill also contains shipping instructions to the airline, a description of the commodity, and applicable transportation charges.  The airline industry has adopted a standard formatted air waybill that accommodates both domestic and international traffic.
